verses.text: Through \w desire|strong="H8378"\w* a man, having \w separated|strong="H6504"\w* himself, \w seeketh|strong="H1245"\w* \add and\add* \w intermeddleth|strong="H1566"\w* with all \w wisdom|strong="H8454"\w*.\f + \fr 18.1 \ft Through…: or, He that separateth himself seeketh according to his desire, and intermeddleth in every business\f*
A \w fool|strong="H3684"\w* hath no \w delight|strong="H2654"\w* in \w understanding|strong="H8394"\w*, but that his \w heart|strong="H3820"\w* may \w discover|strong="H1540"\w* itself.

When the \w wicked|strong="H7563"\w* \w cometh|strong="H0935"\w*, \add then\add* \w cometh|strong="H0935"\w* also \w contempt|strong="H0937"\w*, and with \w ignominy|strong="H7036"\w* \w reproach|strong="H2781"\w*.

The \w words|strong="H1697"\w* of a \w man’s|strong="H0376"\w* \w mouth|strong="H6310"\w* \add are as\add* \w deep|strong="H6013"\w* \w waters|strong="H4325"\w*, \add and\add* the \w wellspring|strong="H4726"\w* of \w wisdom|strong="H2451"\w* \add as\add* a \w flowing|strong="H5042"\w* \w brook|strong="H5158"\w*.

\add It is\add* not \w good|strong="H2896"\w* to \w accept|strong="H5375"\w* the \w person|strong="H6440"\w* of the \w wicked|strong="H7563"\w*, to \w overthrow|strong="H5186"\w* the \w righteous|strong="H6662"\w* in \w judgment|strong="H4941"\w*.

A \w fool’s|strong="H3684"\w* \w lips|strong="H8193"\w* \w enter|strong="H0935"\w* into \w contention|strong="H7379"\w*, and his \w mouth|strong="H6310"\w* \w calleth|strong="H7121"\w* for \w strokes|strong="H4112"\w*.

A \w fool’s|strong="H3684"\w* \w mouth|strong="H6310"\w* \add is\add* his \w destruction|strong="H4288"\w*, and his \w lips|strong="H8193"\w* \add are\add* the \w snare|strong="H4170"\w* of his \w soul|strong="H5315"\w*.

The \w words|strong="H1697"\w* of a \w talebearer|strong="H5372"\w* \add are\add* as \w wounds|strong="H3859"\w*, and they go \w down|strong="H3381"\w* into the innermost \w parts|strong="H2315"\w* of the \w belly|strong="H0990"\w*.\f + \fr 18.8 \ft talebearer: or, whisperer\f*\f + \fr 18.8 \ft as wounds: or, like as when men are wounded\f*\f + \fr 18.8 \ft innermost…: Heb. chambers\f*
He also that is \w slothful|strong="H7503"\w* in his \w work|strong="H4399"\w* is \w brother|strong="H0251"\w* to him that is a \w great|strong="H1167"\w* \w waster|strong="H7843"\w*.

The \w name|strong="H8034"\w* of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \add is\add* a \w strong|strong="H5797"\w* \w tower|strong="H4026"\w*: the \w righteous|strong="H6662"\w* \w runneth|strong="H7323"\w* into it, and is \w safe|strong="H7682"\w*.\f + \fr 18.10 \ft safe: Heb. set aloft\f*

The rich \w man’s|strong="H6223"\w* \w wealth|strong="H1952"\w* \add is\add* his \w strong|strong="H5797"\w* \w city|strong="H7151"\w*, and as an \w high|strong="H7682"\w* \w wall|strong="H2346"\w* in his own \w conceit|strong="H4906"\w*.

\w Before|strong="H6440"\w* \w destruction|strong="H7667"\w* the \w heart|strong="H3820"\w* of \w man|strong="H0376"\w* is \w haughty|strong="H1361"\w*, and \w before|strong="H6440"\w* \w honour|strong="H3519"\w* \add is\add* \w humility|strong="H6038"\w*.

He that \w answereth|strong="H7725"\w* a \w matter|strong="H1697"\w* before he \w heareth|strong="H8085"\w* \add it\add*, it \add is\add* \w folly|strong="H0200"\w* and \w shame|strong="H3639"\w* unto him.\f + \fr 18.13 \ft answereth…: Heb. returneth a word\f*

The \w spirit|strong="H7307"\w* of a \w man|strong="H0376"\w* will \w sustain|strong="H3557"\w* his \w infirmity|strong="H4245"\w*; but a \w wounded|strong="H5218"\w* \w spirit|strong="H7307"\w* who can \w bear|strong="H5375"\w*?

The \w heart|strong="H3820"\w* of the \w prudent|strong="H0995"\w* \w getteth|strong="H7069"\w* \w knowledge|strong="H1847"\w*; and the \w ear|strong="H0241"\w* of the \w wise|strong="H2450"\w* \w seeketh|strong="H1245"\w* \w knowledge|strong="H1847"\w*.
A \w man’s|strong="H0120"\w* \w gift|strong="H4976"\w* maketh \w room|strong="H7337"\w* for him, and \w bringeth|strong="H5148"\w* him \w before|strong="H6440"\w* great \w men|strong="H1419"\w*.

\add He that is\add* \w first|strong="H7223"\w* in his own \w cause|strong="H7379"\w* \add seemeth\add* \w just|strong="H6662"\w*; but his \w neighbour|strong="H7453"\w* \w cometh|strong="H0935"\w* and \w searcheth|strong="H2713"\w* him.
The \w lot|strong="H1486"\w* causeth \w contentions|strong="H4079"\w* to \w cease|strong="H7673"\w*, and \w parteth|strong="H6504"\w* between the \w mighty|strong="H6099"\w*.

A \w brother|strong="H0251"\w* \w offended|strong="H6586"\w* \add is harder to be won\add* than a \w strong|strong="H5797"\w* \w city|strong="H7151"\w*: and \add their\add* \w contentions|strong="H4079"\w* \add are\add* like the \w bars|strong="H1280"\w* of a \w castle|strong="H0759"\w*.

A \w man’s|strong="H0376"\w* \w belly|strong="H0990"\w* shall be \w satisfied|strong="H7646"\w* with the \w fruit|strong="H6529"\w* of his \w mouth|strong="H6310"\w*; \add and\add* with the \w increase|strong="H8393"\w* of his \w lips|strong="H8193"\w* shall he be \w filled|strong="H7646"\w*.

\w Death|strong="H4194"\w* and \w life|strong="H2416"\w* \add are\add* in the \w power|strong="H3027"\w* of the \w tongue|strong="H3956"\w*: and they that \w love|strong="H0157"\w* it shall \w eat|strong="H0398"\w* the \w fruit|strong="H6529"\w* thereof.

\add Whoso\add* \w findeth|strong="H4672"\w* a \w wife|strong="H0802"\w* \w findeth|strong="H4672"\w* a \w good|strong="H2896"\w* \add thing\add*, and \w obtaineth|strong="H6329"\w* \w favour|strong="H7522"\w* of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.
The \w poor|strong="H7326"\w* \w useth|strong="H1696"\w* \w intreaties|strong="H8469"\w*; but the \w rich|strong="H6223"\w* \w answereth|strong="H6030"\w* \w roughly|strong="H5794"\w*.

A \w man|strong="H0376"\w* \add that hath\add* \w friends|strong="H7453"\w* must shew himself \w friendly|strong="H7489"\w*: and there \w is|strong="H3426"\w* a \w friend|strong="H0157"\w* \add that\add* sticketh \w closer|strong="H1695"\w* than a \w brother|strong="H0251"\w*.
